meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pendulous.
meanings.sent1: The pendulousness of the chandelier made it sway gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The tree's branches displayed a natural pendulousness as they drooped towards the ground.
meanings.sent3: The pendulousness of the clown's oversized shoes added to his comedic appearance.
meanings.sent4: Her earrings dangled with such pendulousness that they seemed to dance with every step she took.
meanings.sent5: The pendulousness of the ripe fruit on the tree made it look like a colorful mobile hanging in the air.

meanings.definition: The condition of hanging or swinging freely.
meanings.sent1: The pendulousness of the vines in the jungle allowed monkeys to swing effortlessly from tree to tree.
meanings.sent2: The pendulousness of the wind chime created a soothing sound as it moved in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The pendulousness of the hammock made it the perfect spot for an afternoon nap.
meanings.sent4: The pendulousness of the bell on the cat's collar gave away its location as it moved around the house.
meanings.sent5: The pendulousness of the old swing set brought back memories of carefree days spent playing in the backyard.
